Name: The Physics of Pitching: Learn the Mechanics, Science, and Psychology of Pitching to Success

ReviewList.Text: Enjoyed “The Physics of Pitching’ and know first-hand the experience (8+ years in Major League Baseball...he's been there!) and scientific knowledge Rusty Meacham puts forth in his instructional sessions. Being a 15+year college instructor myself in the sciences, and former player, I’ve observed Rusty’s baseball/pitching instructional style and content with student players at many local baseball clinics. I can attest to Rusty’s expertise as a pitching instructor and overall baseball mentor to young baseball players….Sincerely, Frederick F. Strale, Jr., Ph.D. Indian River State College, Advanced Statistics & Research Methods, 3209 Virginia Ave., Fort Pierce, FL. 34981-5596

I met Len Solesky.  I was lucky enough to get him to sign my copy of this book. If your son or daughter pitch baseball at any level I highly recommend that you get this book and read it to yourself and then have them read it. This man is a wealth of knowledge and he knows how to reach younger pictures as well has older ones.

Fantastic & easy to understand details for young athletes. It`s obvious that Rusty actually played the game as opposed to those who only write about it. The information in this book is easily applied to any young pitcher. Many thanks to Rusty for sharing his knowledge to those of us who don`t have his experience or talent.

This is a great book for a pitcher or coach at any level!  Easy to understand and written by one of the best pitching coaches in the sport.  Pitchers will see improvement in many facets of their game especially on the radar gun.  A must read!!!
